subject: Re: [junit] limited access to data
msgSnippet: ... Very annoying. ... Do your tests need to do the mainframe update? Is that what you re actually testing? Is it enough to verify that you submit the request
messageBody:
>So said Ostermueller, Erik on 2003-07-29 --------------------
>Hello, all.
>
>This post isn't necessarily JUnit related,
>but it is very unit-testing related.
>
>With our legacy mainframe system,
>it is not possible to add or
>delete data on the fly (ie, from a unit test) -- you have to rely on
>nightly batch processes for this.
>
>Since the unit tests can't set up and tear down
>their own data, we're running into lots of snags.

Very annoying.

>Have you all encountered similar situations?
>How have you worked with or worked around them?

Do your tests need to do the mainframe update? Is that what you're actually testing?

Is it enough to verify that you submit the request correctly? Use the Golden Master technique -- handcraft a working request for a batch update, then verify that your code generates an equivalent request. Either use text or some kind of object to represent the request.

Good luck.
